title: Moduli of curves, sheaves, and K3 surfaces
descriptions:
Abstract:

This grant proposal, titled "Moduli of curves, sheaves, and K3 surfaces," seeks funding for a cutting-edge research project in the field of Algebraic Geometry. The proposed study will investigate the intricate structures of moduli spaces, which are mathematical spaces that parametrize algebraic curves, sheaves, and the complex geometries of K3 surfaces. This exploration will delve into the algebra of tautological classes, the structure of Gromov-Witten and Donaldson-Thomas invariants of 3-folds, and the modular properties and Noether-Lefschetz loci of K3 surface invariants.

Leveraging a suite of innovative methodologies, including virtual localization, degeneration techniques, descendent methods, and log geometry, the research aims to develop new geometries such as moduli spaces of stable quotients and stable pairs. These novel approaches promise to shed light on longstanding questions within Algebraic Geometry and forge connections with related fields such as Number Theory, Representation Theory, Topology, and Quantum Field Theory.

The project's significance is manifold, offering potential breakthroughs in our understanding of moduli spacesâ€”a cornerstone concept in mathematics with profound implications for Topology, String Theory, and Classical Algebraic Geometry. As the nexus of these disciplines, the research outcomes are anticipated to have a transformative impact on the theoretical landscape, opening new avenues for mathematical inquiry and interdisciplinary collaboration.

With a robust research framework and an interdisciplinary team poised to tackle the central questions of the study, this proposal represents an ambitious and exciting opportunity to advance the frontiers of Algebraic Geometry and its applications.
